clinical_study.brief_title: A Non-invasive Intervention (BreEStim) for Management of Phantom Limb Pain (PLP) After Limb Amputation (Experiment 1)
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-invasive Intervention (BreEStim) for Management of Phantom Limb Pain (PLP) After Limb Amputation (Experiment 1)

lead_sponsor.agency: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Disability, Independent Living, and Rehabilitation Research

clinical_study.source: The University of Texas Health Science Center, Houston

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effectiveness of innovative intervention of breathing controlled electrical stimulation (BreEStim) and conventional electrical stimulation (EStim) in management of neuropathic phantom limb pain in patients after limb amputation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Pain as measured by the visual analog scale (VAS). Scores are recorded from 0 to10.
primary_outcome.description: Scores are recorded from 0 to 10 with 0 being "no pain" and 10 being "worst pain."

primary_outcome.measure: Change in sensation measured by Electrical sensation detection threshold (EDT)
primary_outcome.description: This is self-reported by the subjects as soon as they first sense the electrical current.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in pain measured by Electrical pain detection threshold (EPT)
primary_outcome.description: This is self-reported by the subjects at the first sensation of pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Heart Rate Variability (HRV) measured by electrocardiogram (ECG)
primary_outcome.description: HRV is a measure of the variation in time between each heartbeat. We use HRV to identify the autonomic nervous system changes after intervention treatment.

arm_group.description: BreEStim is voluntary breathing controlled transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation. EStim is transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation.
BreEStim is voluntary breathing controlled transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation. EStim is transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation.

intervention.description: 120 BreEStim stimuli will applied for about 10 minutes.
120 EStim stimuli will applied for about 10 minutes.
